title: Pepi Lignana 2013 Il Cucchetto  (Maremma Toscana)
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon and 15% Petit Verdot, this opens with aromas of black-skinned berry, green olive and a whiff of pencil shaving. The straightforward palate offers black-currant jam, vanilla and a whiff of tobacco alongside round tannins.

title: Perelada NV Torre Galatea Brut Rosé Sparkling (Cava)
description: Orange and other citrus aromas are a touch creamy and yeasty. A medium-bodied palate is average in feel, while touches of spice and smoke accent mild orange flavors. The finish is simple.

title: Podere Prospero 2015  Bolgheri
description: A blend of Cabernet Sauvignon, Merlot and Cabernet Franc, this has delicate aromas of black plum and baking spice. The dense palate offers prune, espresso and cedar alongside close-grained, rather astringent tannins.

title: Poggio al Tufo 2015  Maremma Toscana
description: Made entirely with Alicante, this presents aromas suggesting red-skinned berry, white pepper and leather. The easygoing palate offers cranberry, clove and exotic spice alongside smooth tannins. Enjoy soon.

title: Ram 2016 Riesling (Willamette Valley)
description: This is Riesling for acid lovers; it screams out for freshly shucked oysters. Bone dry, quite tart, it's right on the edge of sour, with freshly squeezed lemon flavors in abundance. When matched to the right food, it should be a home run.

title: Remy 2015 Lone Madrone Vineyard Three Wives Giulio Pinot Noir (Dundee Hills)
description: There's a strong flavor of grilled fruits, especially peaches, and the red fruits are tangy and concentrated, like raspberry compote. A charred smoky streak runs through the tannins. All in all, though a bit heavy handed, this brings lots of potent flavors. Drink now through 2020.
designation: Lone Madrone Vineyard Three Wives Giulio

title: Rock Point NV River Riesling-Muscat (Oregon)
description: Principally Riesling, with 8% Muscat blended in, this touches the borders of off dry, but has enough acid to keep it food-friendly. Ripe lemon and pink grapefruit, peaches and apples come through most pleasantly. It's well made and well balanced.

title: Salcheto 2012 Salco  (Vino Nobile di Montepulciano)
description: Toast, underbrush, licorice and charred-earth aromas carry over to the palate along with prune, blackberry extract, coconut and a confectionary note. Dusty tannins give it a rather grainy finish.

title: San Marzano 2016 Edda Lei White (Salento)
description: A mix of 60% Chardonnay, 15% Moscatello Selvatico, 15% Minutolo and 10% Passulara, this unusual white blend is perfumed in grapefruit, tangerine zest, papaya and lemon balm aromas. Medium in weight, with a pleasing roundness, rich melon and exuberant floral flavors are lifted by clementine acidity and a light mineral dusting.

title: Seacampo 2016 Casa Américo White (Dão)
description: The 1,500-foot elevation of the vineyards close to mountains gives this wine its crisp, bright character, allowing the acidity, the citrus and the zingy texture to shine. The wine is all tight fruit balanced by a creamy texture. Drink now.

title: Sunset Hills 2016 Estate Vineyard One Chardonnay (Middleburg)
description: Notes of wet stone, Pilsner and yeast meet with fresher elements of lemon, white pepper and honeydew in this Chardonnay. Sprightly acidity lends itself well to the long, energetic finish.

title: Symington Family Estates 2016 Altano Organic Red (Douro)
description: Produced from organically grown grapes in the upper Douro Superior region, this wine is bursting with ripe fruit and soft tannins. Blackberries and black currants give a ripe, full-throated fruitiness. Drink this wine from 2019.

title: The Four Graces 2016 Pinot Gris (Willamette Valley)
description: Though well made and easy drinking, this has an overall lightness that seems almost too thin. Flavors conjure up snippets of lemon rind, pineapple and honeydew melon—fruity but lacking concentration. It's balanced with mineral acidity, and should be enjoyed while at its most fresh.

title: Three of Cups 2015 L'Astre Les Collines Vineyard Syrah (Walla Walla Valley (WA))
description: Vibrant aromas of blue fruit, dried herb and potpourri lead to light, soft, tart fruit and barrel flavors. Blue-fruit flavors linger on the finish. It seems compact right now but good things are going on.

title: William Heritage 2016 Pumpkin Hill Vineyard Chardonnay (Outer Coastal Plain)
description: This Chardonnay opens with alluring aromas of vanilla, lemon curd, dried apricot and pie crust. Lemon-lime acidity pulls together flavors of ripe peach and vanilla, with a hint of wood spice. Lime peel and spice linger on the fruity finish.

title: 1+1=3 NV Mètode Tradicional Brut Sparkling (Cava)
description: Confident saline and citrus aromas are a good entry to this clean, fairly lean brut. Lime and tangerine flavors are racy and not too sweet, while this is fresh and well made on the finish.

title: A Mano 2015 Imprint Primitivo (Puglia)
description: There's a surprising intensity to the aromas of fresh blackberries, turned earth and violets. The palate mirrors the nose in a package of grippy tannins and crisp acidity. While enjoyably straightforward in nature, the concentration is rather light, so enjoy for its immediate appeal.

title: Airlie 2016 Pinot Blanc (Willamette Valley)
description: The best of Airlie's current white wine releases, this is bright and fruity, with cucumber and green apple in the mix. The mouthfeel is lively, and the flavors show a bit of residual sugar, resulting in an impression not entirely unlike vinous Gatorade.

title: Ancilla 2016 Ella  (Lugana)
description: Delicate aromas of yellow stone fruit and a yeasty whiff of baked bread lift out of the glass. On the palate, a light almond note underscores yellow peach, candied tangerine zest and white grapefruit. Bright acidity gives it a refreshing finish.

title: Angel Vine 2016 Queen of Quite a Lot Rosé of Pinot Noir (Willamette Valley)
description: As the low alcohol suggests, this is a light and just barely ripe rosé, a salmon shade with a blush of cherry red. Tart flavors of strawberry and rhubarb are dusted with a dash of Thai spices.
designation: Queen of Quite a Lot Rosé of

title: Château Loirac 2015  Médoc
description: This fruit-driven wine also has a firm, dry structure. The 29-acre vineyard is dominated by 70% Cabernet Sauvignon, which is reflected in the wine. Black currants are backed by a dry core of tannin from the fruit as much as wood. Drink this wine from 2022.

title: Château Noaillac 2015  Médoc
description: This northern Médoc estate has produced a wine that has both structure and fruit. The tannins are certainly present, giving a burnt character from the wood aging. However, black currant flavors are there as well. Put the two together as they integrate, and the wine will be juicy and attractive. Drink from 2020.

title: Château Pontey 2015  Médoc
description: This fruity wine is soft, rounded and already well balanced between fruit and tannins. It has a lightly dry core but the red berry flavors and acidity are up front, giving this wine its immediate attraction. Drink from 2019.

title: Château Potensac 2015 Chapelle de Potensac  (Médoc)
description: The second wine from Potensac is based on its great fruit. It offers black currants, acidity and a warm, ripe character from the Merlot that dominates this wine. It is juicy, spicy and has a crisp fresh aftertaste. Drink from 2021.

title: Christie's 2015 Quinta dona Mafalda Touriga Nacional (Douro)
description: Pure, rich ripe Touriga Nacional gives a perfumed wine, rich in tannins and with a stylish character from the bright red fruits. The wine is juicy, balanced, and certain to age well. Drink from 2019.

title: Clos Saint-Martin 2015  Saint-Émilion
description: Almost completely Merlot, this red-fruit-driven wine is permeated by a toasty character that needs to soften. The freshness of the vintage and balanced fruit and acidity are developing well. Drink from 2023.

title: Caves Velhas 2015 Catedral Reserva Red (Dão)
description: Alfrocheiro, Tinta Roriz and Touriga Nacional are blended in this broad, rich wine. With generous tannins that are well integrated into the rich black fruits, it is ripe, juicy and has swathes of fruit and acidity. Drink this balanced wine from 2019.

title: Chacewater 2016 Chardonnay (Lake County)
description: Earthy, buttery aromas join good fruity ones in this medium-bodied and mineral-tinged wine. It has firm acidity and a slightly astringent texture that give it a lean, bracing quality.

title: Château Barthez 2015  Haut-Médoc
description: This ripe and fruity wine comes from the south of the Haut-Médoc, close to Bordeaux. With some dry tannins as well as black-plum fruits, it is rich, textured and set for aging. The wine will be ready from 2023.

title: Château Fontis 2015  Médoc
description: This wine is full of black currants and spice. Tannins give a core of dryness that is a firm point in the fruitiness of this attractive wine. Drink from 2019.
